title: Update App from Previous Version *[requires ticket]
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user installed a previous version of the Ballpark app 
AND user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
AND user has selected a favorite team
AND user has at least one ticketed event on their account
AND user has navigated to team tab
custom_steps:
WHEN Ballpark app is left in background
AND Ballpark app version is upgraded by installing a new version
custom_expected: THEN User should be on latest version, should be logged in and all data retained.

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN Loading previous production version from AppStore or Google Play store.
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Previous version installs properly.

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN Log in with a user, preferably one with various tickets.
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Login successful.

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN User goes to More > About Ballpark > About Ballpark
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN previous app version is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN User navigates to Profile -> My Teams AND user selects a favorite team

WHEN User navigates to Tickets > Wallet AND views tickets, including barcodes within Scan view

WHEN User navigates to Team Tab
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Everything should load with correct data.

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user background the Ballpark app

WHEN Download the production version from Firebase App distro or TestFlight if the production version has been pushed to TestFlight. 
AND User opens the new version of the app
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN App should replace and load properly form the previous build

AND User remains logged in. 

NOTE - This is the most important thing to verify - the DB/user's login data is preserved and then user doesn't have to login again.

custom_steps_separated.content: HEN User goes to More > About Ballpark > About Ballpark
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Upgraded app version is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN User goes to Profile -> My Teams
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN User's prior favorite team is preserved

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN User goes to Tickets > Wallet
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Users ticket is shown with correct data

title: Onboarding New Signup
custom_preconds: GIVEN User has installed the app, starts app for first time and is presented with Splash Screen

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN User taps option to get started 

(if prev logged into the device on prev BP versions, then 'Continue with MLB' button will be shown. If this is the case, tap 'Don't have an account? Sign up' link)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN User is presented with Sign Up screen

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user enter valid first and last name, email address, password, and Date of Birth
AND user taps 'Continue'


NOTE: First and Last name can be any character including space and special characters
NOTE: DOB does not have a lower boundary restriction for Year - ex: 01/01/0001 is considered valid
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN account creation is successful
AND Home Tab is presented

title: Onboarding User - Installing BP app via Branch Deeplink *[requires app store]
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user does not have BP app installed previously (delete any/all instances from device)
AND user has been given a branch deeplink to access the app
AND user does not have an existing MLB account
custom_steps:
WHEN user accesses the deeplink 
AND user in directed to App store (Android/iOS)
AND user installed the app
AND user creates a new account and completes onboarding
custom_expected:
THEN the deferred deep link resolves and user navigates to the view referenced in the embedded Branch quick link

** Examples: deeplink of https://bp.mlb.com/cubs directs user to Cubs team page, while deeplink of https://bp.mlb.com/Wallet directs user to Wallet page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user accesses the deeplink - https://bp.mlb.com/cubs
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is directed to App store prompting install of Ballpark App

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user installs BP* 

IOS NOTE: Testflight can be substituted, if desired version has not been released
Android NOTE: *requires for user to be part of internal testers to allow for install of Release Candidate from Playstore prior to launch. AppTester build can be substituted, if not part of internal tester group OR if desired version has not been released
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN installation of BP app completes successfully

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user opens BP app
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is presented with Splash Screen

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN User taps option to get started

(iOS may show 'Continue with MLB' button if prev logged into the device on prev versions. If this is the case, tap 'Don't have an account? Sign up' link)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Onboarding process begins by presenting user the Sign Up Screen

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user enters valid data for all the fields
AND user submits continue
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN account creation is successful 
AND user is logged in successful
AND BP app is navigated to the view referenced in the embedded Branch quick link 

(If https://bp.mlb.com/cubs was accessed initially, then user should be shown the Cubs team page)

title: [iOS] Allow location CTA - Precise
custom_preconds:
[BP-9161](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-9161)

As a fan, I want to be informed my location is not available or imprecise so I know to turn it on

GIVEN an existing user DOES NOT have device location enable **
AND user is on the HomeTab 


** 'Never', 'Ask Next Time'
*** Precise setting is applicable for iOS (all supported versions)
custom_steps:
WHEN user is shown 'No Location' text on the HomeTab
AND user is shown 'Change my location' CTA 
AND user taps on 'Change my location'
custom_expected:
THEN Ballpark app triggers the OS allow permissions prompt **


** If fan has already been presented with the OS permissions dialog, CTA will deeplink into their device settings for Ballpark app so they can make a change through their OS

custom_steps_separated.content:
GIVEN a fresh install of Ballpark App
AND the device location is set to 'Never'

WHEN an existing user logs in and is on the HomeTab
AND the user taps on 'Change my location'
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN Ballpark device triggers the OS allow permissions prompt with the header text:
'Allow "Ballpark" to use your location?'
AND subtext within prompt is shown:
'Your location will be used to check-in, map positioning and to recommend near by events’  AND within prompt the user is shown options:
- 'Allow Once'
- 'Allow While Using the App'
- 'Don't Allow'
AND an option to set Precise as ON/OFF, with setting as ON 



** If fan has already been presented with the OS permissions dialog, CTA will deeplink into their device settings for Ballpark app so they can make a change through their OS

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user taps 'Don't Allow' within the Ballpark prompt

** If fan had already been presented with the OS permissions dialog, CTA will deeplink into their device settings for Ballpark app so they can make a change through their OS
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the Ballpark prompt to allow location is dismissed
AND 'No Location' text is displayed 
AND 'Change my location' CTA is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on 'Change my location' CTA from the HomePage
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user is directed into their device settings for Ballpark app so they can make a change through their OS
AND the Location setting is shown as 'Never'/'Deny'/'Don't allow'

custom_steps_separated.content:
GIVEN a fresh install of Ballpark App
AND the device location is set to 'Ask Next Time'
WHEN an existing user logs in and is on the HomeTab
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN 'No Location' text is displayed
AND 'Change my location' CTA is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on 'Change my location'
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN Ballpark device triggers the OS allow permissions prompt with the header text:
'Allow "Ballpark" to use your location?'
AND subtext within prompt is shown:
'Your location will be used to check-in, map positioning and to recommend near by events’  
AND within prompt the user is shown options:
- 'Allow Once'
- 'Allow While Using the App'
- 'Don't Allow'
AND an option to set Precise as ON/OFF, with setting as ON 


** If fan has already been presented with the OS permissions dialog, CTA will deeplink into their device settings for Ballpark app so they can make a change through their OS

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user taps 'Allow Once' within the Ballpark prompt

** If fan had already been presented with the OS permissions dialog, CTA will deeplink into their device settings for Ballpark app so they can make a change through their OS
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the Ballpark prompt to allow location is dismissed
AND the location of the device is displayed, such as 'San Francisco, CA'
AND no CTA is present to change location

*Venue Header img/txt could possible replace the location (if device is located within venue)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user restarts the Ballpark App
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN 'No Location' text is displayed
AND 'Change my location' CTA is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on 'Change my location'
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN Ballpark device triggers the OS allow permissions prompt with the header text:
'Allow "Ballpark" to use your location?'
AND subtext within prompt is shown:
'Your location will be used to check-in, map positioning and to recommend near by events’  
AND within prompt the user is shown options:
- 'Allow Once'
- 'Allow While Using the App'
- 'Don't Allow'
AND an option to set Precise as ON/OFF, with setting as ON 


** If fan has already been presented with the OS permissions dialog, CTA will deeplink into their device settings for Ballpark app so they can make a change through their OS

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps 'Allow While Using App' within the Ballpark prompt
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the Ballpark prompt to allow location is dismissed
AND the location of the device is displayed, such as 'San Francisco, CA'
AND no CTA is present to change location

*Venue Header img/txt could possible replace the location (if device is located within venue)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user restarts the Ballpark App
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the location of the device is displayed, such as 'San Francisco, CA'
AND no CTA is present to change location

*Venue Header img/txt could possible replace the location (if device is located within venue)

title: [Android all supported] Allow location CTA - Precise
custom_preconds:
[BPA-6147](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BPA-6147)

As a fan, I want to be informed my location is not available so I know to turn it on

GIVEN an existing user DOES NOT have device location enable **
AND user is on the HomeTab 


** 'Deny'/'Don't allow' (some device/OS can also display 'Deny & don't ask again')
(OS 11 introduces 'Ask Every time')
*** Android always sets Precision ON for Android OS 11 and lower. (OS 12 introduces approximate)
custom_steps:
WHEN user is shown 'No Location' text on the HomeTab
AND user is shown 'Change my location' CTA 
AND user taps on 'Change my location'
custom_expected:
THEN Ballpark app triggers the OS allow permissions prompt **

![](index.php?/attachments/get/13391717)
Above image is for Samsung Galaxy 10+ OS10 device


** If fan has already been presented with the OS permissions dialog, CTA will deeplink into their device settings for Ballpark app so they can make a change through their OS
*** Android always sets Precision ON for Android OS 11 and lower. (OS 12 introduces approximate)

custom_steps_separated.content:
GIVEN a FRESH install of Ballpark App*
AND the device location is set to 'Never'/'Deny'/'Don't allow'

WHEN an existing user logs in and is on the HomeTab
AND the user taps on 'Change my location'


*best to uninstall and delete any prev existing instances of BP and then installing again.
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN Ballpark device triggers the OS allow permissions prompt with the header text:
'Allow Ballpark to access this device's location?'*

*if apptester build is used, may see something like 'BP Prod Debug' instead of 'Ballpark' in header prompt

AND within prompt the user is shown options:
- 'Allow only while using the app' / 'While using the app'
- 'Only this time' (Android 11/12)
- 'Deny' / 'Don't allow'
- 'Deny & don't ask again' (some device/OS also has this setting shown)

[ONLY FOR ANDROID OS12 AND ABOVE]
AND an option to set Precise OR Approximate as circle image, with setting as Precise indicated via highlighted circle ***


*** Android always sets Precision ON for Android OS 11 and lower. (OS 12 introduces approximate option to user)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps 'Don't Allow'/'Deny' within the Ballpark prompt
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the Ballpark prompt to allow location is dismissed

AND 'No Location' text is displayed 
AND 'Change my location' CTA is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on 'Change my location'
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN Ballpark device triggers the OS allow permissions prompt
AND within prompt the user is shown options:
- 'Allow only while using the app' / 'While using the app'
- 'Only this time' (Android 11/12)
- 'Deny' / 'Don't allow'
- 'Deny & don't ask again' (some device/OS also has this setting shown)


[ONLY FOR ANDROID OS12 AND ABOVE]
AND an option to set Precise OR Approximate as circle image, with setting as Precise indicated via highlighted circle


** If fan has already been presented with the OS permissions dialog, CTA will deeplink into their device settings for Ballpark app so they can make a change through their OS (AND the Location setting is shown as 'Never'/'Deny'/'Don't allow')

custom_steps_separated.content:
[FOR ANDROID 10 OS AND LOWER OR IF DEVICE PROMPT NOT SHOWING THE OPTION DESCRIBED, SKIP TO STEP 11]

GIVEN a FRESH install of Ballpark App*
AND the device location is set to 'Ask Next Time'/ 'Ask every time' 
WHEN an existing user logs in and is on the HomeTab

*best to uninstall and delete any prev existing instances of BP and then installing again.
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN 'No Location' text is displayed
AND 'Change my location' CTA is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on 'Change my location'
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN Ballpark device triggers the OS allow permissions prompt
AND within prompt the user is shown options:
- 'Allow only while using the app' / 'While using the app'
- 'Only this time' (Android 11/12)
- 'Deny' / 'Don't allow'
- 'Deny & don't ask again' (some device/OS also has this setting shown)

[ONLY FOR ANDROID OS12 AND ABOVE]
AND an option to set Precise OR Approximate as circle image, with setting as Precise indicated via highlighted circle



** If fan has already been presented with the OS permissions dialog, CTA will deeplink into their device settings for Ballpark app so they can make a change through their OS (AND the Location setting is shown as 'Never'/'Deny'/'Don't allow')

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps 'Allow Once'/'Only this time' within the Ballpark prompt
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the Ballpark prompt to allow location is dismissed
AND the location of the device is displayed, such as 'San Francisco, CA'
AND no CTA is present to change location

*Venue Header img/txt could possible replace the location (if device is located within venue)

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user restarts the Ballpark App *

*may need to allow some time (few minutes) before reopening the BP app to ensure state has been cleared
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN 'No Location' text is displayed
AND 'Change my location' CTA is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on 'Change my location'
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN Ballpark device triggers the OS allow permissions prompt
AND within prompt the user is shown options:
- 'Allow only while using the app' / 'While using the app'
- 'Only this time' (Android 11/12)
- 'Deny' / 'Don't allow'
- 'Deny & don't ask again' (some device/OS also has this setting shown)

[ONLY FOR ANDROID OS12 AND ABOVE]
AND an option to set Precise OR Approximate as circle image, with setting as Precise indicated via highlighted circle


** If fan has already been presented with the OS permissions dialog, CTA will deeplink into their device settings for Ballpark app so they can make a change through their OS (AND the Location setting is shown as 'Never'/'Deny'/'Don't allow')

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user taps 'Allow While Using App' within the Ballpark prompt 
(OR updates via Device Settings)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the Ballpark prompt to allow location is dismissed (if Ballpark prompt was shown prev)

AND the location of the device is displayed, such as 'San Francisco, CA'
AND no CTA is present to change location

*Venue Header img/txt could possible replace the location (if device is located within venue)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user restarts the Ballpark App
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the location of the device is displayed, such as 'San Francisco, CA'
AND no CTA is present to change location

*Venue Header img/txt could possible replace the location (if device is located within venue)

title: Buy Tickets Segment
custom_preconds: Given User has Ballpark app installed

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user has no favorite team selected
AND navigates to the Wallet Tab
And taps on the "Buy Tickets" Section
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN No Games please change your filter to view tickets will be displayed in the center of the screen.

Select A Team will be displayed on the top left button

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user selects a team from the Team Picker
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the selected team's schedule is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user has never visited the buy tickets Team picker
AND has at least one favorite team selected
AND navigates to the Wallet Tab
And taps on the "Buy Tickets" Section
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the number one ranked favorite team's schedule is displayed.

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user has at least one favorite team associated with account
AND user has made a previous selection on the Buy Tickets team picker
AND navigates to the Wallet Tab
And taps on the "Buy Tickets" section
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the previously selected team's schedule will be displayed,  if different from the favorite team.

title: Ticket List Interface
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user with tickets in their Acct is logged into BP
AND user taps Ticket Tab
custom_steps: WHEN the user taps on a matchup entry
custom_expected:
WIKI :https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/mobile/pages/3225634/03+Wallet+Tab#id-03WalletTab-1.1.4TicketList-Forwardvia...

THEN Wallet displays with My tickets page with all tickets in the account

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on a matchups that does NOT have forwards completed
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN header should say "Tickets"

AND the app will display the matchup data in sub header (cap logo away and home, away team @ home team, date and start time, venue name)

** if NGE do not display logos and show NGE description instead of team name
AND the app will display headers for section, seat and row
AND the app will display each ticket as its own row with section, seat and row values
AND the app will display "Open" link button for each row
AND the app will display the "Forward Tickets" button centered at the bottom (above the Navbar)

AND everything on this view will scroll
BUT the 'Tickets' header & buttons at the bottom will not scroll

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on a matchups that has forwards completed
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN header should say "Tickets"

AND the app will display the matchup data in sub header (cap logo away and home, away team @ home team, date and start time, venue name)
AND the app will display headers for section, seat and row
AND the app will display each ticket as its own row with section, seat and row values

AND the app will display "Open" link button for each row for ticket that has NOT been forwarded 
AND the app will display "Recall" link button for each row for ticket that has been forwarded
AND the app will display the "Forward Tickets" button centered at the bottom (above the Navbar)

title: Ticket Scan View
custom_preconds: GIVEN User has events on account with both single and multiple tickets
custom_steps: WHEN the user opens the scan view
custom_expected:
WIKI :https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/mobile/pages/3226270/00+Ticket+Scan+View#id-00TicketScanView-1.1TicketScanView

THEN the correct Scanview is shown without swiping capability and card does not move in ticket scan, if single ticket
OR
THEN the correct Scanview is shown with swiping capability and peeking to additional, if multiple tickets



On tap of close X, scan view slides down.

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user has single ticketed event
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the ticket is centered without any additional tickets peeking, neither to right or left
AND swiping has no effect

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user has 2+ ticketed event
And user opens the scan view
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the 1st ticket is centered, 2nd ticket is peeking in from right

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user swipes the to the left to view the additional tickets
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the 1st ticket is peeking out from the left
AND the 2nd ticket is now centered
AND additional ticket is peaking out from the right, if additional ticket exists

** for last card, no card will peek from the right, only cards will peek from left.

title: Forward Ticket - Don't Auto Select
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that the user purchased tickets

AND the user navigated to Wallet tab

AND the user tapped on one of the matchups
custom_steps: WHEN I tap on “Forward Tickets” in the ticket-list view

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user taps on 'Forward Tickets' button 
AND User has more than 1 ticket (multiple ticket)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will display a selectable list with NO checkboxes appearing on every row  when putting the user in a "Forward mode" 
AND FIRST Ticket should not be auto-selected 
AND Forward Tickets should be remained greyed out

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user taps on 'Forward Tickets' button 
AND User has only 1 ticket to forward
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will display a selectable list with checkbox appearing on the available only ticket checked when putting the user in a "Forward Mode"
AND Forward TicketsCTAs should be highlighted in blue color
AND there should be behavior around unselected tickets will function as currently expected

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user has parking pass with their Single Game Event
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will display a selectable list with NO checkboxes appearing on every row  when putting the user in a "Forward mode" 
AND FIRST Ticket should not be auto-selected 
AND Forward Tickets should be remained greyed out

title: Forwarding via Email - Interface
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that the user purchased tickets

AND the user selected tickets to forward

AND the user tapped on 'Forward'/'Forward Tickets' button

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on 'Via Email'
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app display the Ticket Forward email form

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user enters the information in the fields provided
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will validate the information provided by the user (the app will the emails standards: some text, an at symbol followed by a domain)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user completes the form and taps on 'Send'
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will trigger the network call to send the selected tickets to the recipient email address entered by the user

AND the form will slide down and return the user to the list view no longer in "Forward mode"
AND the app will display a success message

title: Forwarding via Link
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the sending user has forward-able tickets on their account



TESTING NOTES:
*This test case is best to be validated with 2 devices/accts to closer validate the true user experience. A single device can be used, but may be more difficult to verify.
*This test case is best to be validated against Prod env. This will prevent testing friction within QA/Staging env, due to beta prompt and requiring credentials. [MLB Beta Login page requiring creds (Username: beta-user / Password – b3ta@mlb.com)]

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the sending user selected tickets to forward
AND the user tapped on 'Forward Tickets' button 
AND the user taps on 'Share Link'
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will display the OS share sheet and make the API call to forward the ticket

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user selects one of the sharing apps/options
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app populate the user's device share option with the "shareURL" from the boxoffice service

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user finishes selecting share option of the ticket
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the share flow will dismiss 
AND the user will no longer be in "Forward mode"

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the sending user finishes forwarding
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will refresh the list and will indicate which tickets are now forwarding in progress (pending via link)

custom_steps_separated.content:
*best to use a different device/acct

WHEN the receiving user accesses the share link
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user will be shown 'Accepting Tickets' page via mlb.com with an 'Access Ticket' button

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the receiving user taps 'Access Ticket' button from within Accepting Tickets page
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user will be presented 'Open in Ballpark?' prompt

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the receiving user taps 'Open' within 'Open in Ballpark?' prompt
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the ballpark app will be opened to the Tickets tab
AND 'Ticket Accepted - You've received a ticket forward from <sending_user_email>.' with an 'OK' button
AND the prompt is layered on top of the WalletView displaying the ticketed events* 

*this assumes no prev tickets were active on the acct where the newly accepted transfer's card is shown. If prev ticketed events are prev on the acct AND if the events occurs prior to the transfer, then the soonest events are displayed.

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the receiving user navigates to view the recently accepted ticket
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user is able to see the listview AND the scanview of the ticketed event

*barcode should be shown, if prev shown from sending user ('Barcode Unavailable' can be shown initially to sending user, and therefore would be the same shown to the receiving user)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the sending user navigates/refreshes the recently forward ticket
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the ticket entry should be updated from 'Forward pending via link' to ticket has been accepted by the receiving user

title: Embargoed Barcode*
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user has installed Ballpark App
AND user is logged in with an account
AND user has tickets associated with the account which has ticket with embargoes barcode
custom_steps: WHEN user tap on “Forward Tickets” in the ticket-list view

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN use have a valid embargoed ticket 

AND user select “Forward tickets”
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user should be presented a checkbox to select (if have multiple ticket) and forwarding should be enabled

(Don't auto Select if user have multiple ticket will be covered in [test case](https://testrail.testeng.mlbinfra.net/index.php?/cases/view/29995582&group_by=cases:section_id&group_order=asc&group_id=1251461 ))
AND user able to forward tickets without any issue

title: Team Park Info
custom_preconds: GIVEN User navigates to Team Tab with no favorite team

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN Team Picker is displayed
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN User is able to select team since all teams are present, team picker screen is dismissed after selection and selected team info is displayed in Team Tab
AND the app will display the venue image on the top

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN User selects a Big Icon from Park Info
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN associated page/webview is presented

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN User closes page/webview
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is returned to team tab item

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN User select item from small carousel
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN associated page/webview is presented

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN User closes page/webview
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is returned to team tab item

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN User selects icon and text items
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN associated page/webview is presented

title: Profile Page  - Personalization ON [iOS >= 11.5.0, ANDROID >=12.0.0]
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app
AND user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app


Relevant links:
[Home - Personalized welcome message](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-9826 )
* Android - [BPA-6459](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BPA-6459 )
* iOS - [BP-9342](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-9342 )

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user is on the HomeTab
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user is shown a welcome message with their first name shown (if there is name associated with mlb.com acct)

AND the user is shown an avatar with first and last name initials (if there is first and last name associated with mlb.com acct)
AND the avatar is the primary color of the users favorite team (if there is a fave team associated with the mlb.com acct)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps on the Profile icon from Home Tab
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user is shown 'My Profile' as the header
THEN the user is shown Inbox icon in upper right corner
THEN My Profile card is shown with Avatar(initials), Name, Email, Edit button
AND My Profile card has the Team Color/Logo shown as background (gray w/o logo for user w/out fave team)

THEN the user is shown 'My History' card layered atop the profile card with the User's (check ins) from their My History data:
* Total Check-Ins - dash('-') shown if no prev check-ins exist
* Total Teams Seen - dash('-') shown if no prev check-ins exist 
* Total Ballparks Visited - dash('-') shown if no prev check-ins exist 
* 'View Details' blue text link navigating user to My History 

NOTE: If history data is unavailable display dashes for history counts. User is still able to navigate to My History

THEN the user is shown links to settings items with icons displayed next to each row
* My Teams
* My Notifications
* My MLB Account Emails
* My Ticket Accounts
THEN the user is shown 'Log Out' button below list items
